Sounds like you want to set a variable on state. something like this.state.showSomething = false. Then set this to true when when you click the button. (e) => this.setState({showSomething: true}). In your render method check this value using one of the conditional rendering techniques.

You don't want to return any JSX from the buttons click. Instead you want to button click to set some logic that triggers a render and have the render method do the work of showing something.

Not sure if this is the problem, but you are missing `type="submit"` on your button. It should be:

```<button className="black_btn" type="submit">Submit</button>```
My Code: <https://github.com/AwesomeZaidi/Clubs-App-Frontend/blob/asim/basic-views/src/Components/Dashboard/Dashboard.jsx>

attachments.text:
turns out the solution is to downgrade `react-scripts` to v2.1.3 until they fix the issue in v2.1.6: <https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/issues/6399>

You can do so using `yarn add react-scripts@2.1.3` then deleting *node_modules* folder and re-running `yarn` to install packages

attachments.text: Welcome to the Create React App documentation!
attachments.title: About the Documentation · Create React App
attachments.fallback: About the Documentation · Create React App

text: <https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/documentation-intro>

You can use state. 

You should have three “states” to track. 

When the component is idle and you haven’t started to fetch anything. 

When you loading data. The fetching process has started. You probably clicked the submit button. 

When the process is complete. Fetch has completed successfully or with an error. 

At each of these steps you can set state. This will trigger a render. In your render method you can use conditional rendering to control what’s displayed. 

This seems like it is aimed at the question you were asking above. Though if I recall challenge 4 was to add a style sheet.
